alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Forsyth and northwestern Davidson Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 418 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bermuda Run, or 8 miles northeast of Mocksville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winston-Salem, Lexington, Clemmons, Bermuda Run, Linwood, Arcadia, Welcome and High Rock Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding or ponding of water on roadways. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
